content.question: The mechanism of action of many common medications involves interfering with the normal pathways that cells use to respond to hormone signals. Which of the following best describes a drug interaction that directly interferes with a signal transduction pathway?

choices.label: A medication causes the cell to absorb more of a particular mineral, eventually poisoning the cell.
A medication enters the target cell and inhibits an enzyme that normally synthesizes a second messenger.
A medication enters the target cellâ€™s nucleus and acts as a mutagen.
A medication interrupts the transcription of ribosomal RNA genes.

content.answer: A medication enters the target cell and inhibits an enzyme that normally synthesizes a second messenger.
